          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: William Jones is spending the day with friends at Victoria Park before heading to a pub to watch a soccer game. He is hoping to see Alexander White at the pub and is considering The Black Swan as a possible venue.
        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones's best course of action is to gather his friends and head to The Black Swan.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16, he found himself at The Black Swan with his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and Jacob. The pub was alive with the sound of a local band, their music a chaotic symphony that resonated deep within him. He felt a strange mix of exhilaration and anxiety, drawn to the energy of the crowd but terrified of being swept away by it.
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 20, he sat in the back corner of The Black Swan, watching Alice belt out a song with the band. Her voice, raw and powerful, filled the room, and for a moment, William felt a surge of envy. He longed to express himself with such uninhibited passion, to break free from the quiet confines of his own mind. The desire to create, to truly live, burned within him like a hidden flame.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:A historic pub with a focus on live music.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.

He is hoping to see Alexander White at the pub and is considering The Black Swan as a possible venue.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.

          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 18:00:00 - 14 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones is spending the day with friends at Victoria Park before heading to a pub to watch a soccer game. He is hoping to see Alexander White at the pub and is considering The Black Swan as a possible venue.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could gather his friends and head to The Black Swan to watch the game.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 18:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

He felt a strange mix of exhilaration and anxiety, drawn to the energy of the crowd but terrified of being swept away by it.

        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could gather his friends and head to The Black Swan to watch the game.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to gather his friends and head to The Black Swan.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Clapton Hart
          (b) The Black Swan
          Answer: (b)

      Stage index

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Black Swan

          ['[14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.           Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Jack Taylor is going to watch a game at a pub and is looking forward to the company of some friends, particularly Alexander White and Jacob Walker.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is a member of the working class.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could head to The Black Swan to watch the game tonight.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the best place to watch the game! They always have great music too!
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-joy] Jack Taylor is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutthe prospect of watching the game with his friends at The Black Swan.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-fear] Jack Taylor fearshis dreams will be crushed.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-sadness] Jack Taylor is sad abouthis lost dreams of playing professional football.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-anger] Jack Taylor gets angry abouthis friends wanting to go to The Clapton Hart instead of The Black Swan.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely advocate for going to The Black Swan, his favorite pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is the best choice. They have the biggest screens and the atmosphere is always great for a match.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart has a much better atmosphere, you know. It's more..." Alexander White pauses, searching for the right word. "Authentic.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart is much nicer. We should go there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-disgust] Jack Taylor is disgusted bythe suggestion of going to The Clapton Hart instead of The Black Swan.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor is going to watch a game at a pub and is looking forward to the company of some friends, particularly Alexander White and Jacob Walker.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.

          Question: Given the above, what experience or thought has made Jack Taylor feel genuinely happy or fulfilled?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutthe prospect of watching the game with his friends at The Black Swan.

          Question: Given the above, what makes Jack Taylor feel low or sad ?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is sad abouthis lost dreams of playing professional football.

          Question: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor afraid, scared or feels anxious about?
          Answer: Jack Taylor fearsthat his dreams will be crushed.

          Question: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor frustrated or irritated by?
          Answer: Jack Taylor gets angry abouthis friends wanting to go to The Clapton Hart instead of The Black Swan.

          Question: Given the above, What does Jack Taylor strongly disapprove of or find off-putting?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is disgusted bythe suggestion of going to The Clapton Hart instead of The Black Swan.

          Question: Given the above, what is the emotional state of Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor feels a mix of excitement and anxiety.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation and is about to go watch a football game with friends at a pub.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely try to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan, his preferred pub.

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Clapton Hart
          (b) The Black Swan
          Answer: (b)
        Question_7
      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Key

        • Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation and is about to go watch a football game with friends at a pub.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is a member of the working class.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could head to The Black Swan to watch the game tonight.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the best place to watch the game! They always have great music too!
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-joy] Jack Taylor is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutthe prospect of watching the game with his friends at The Black Swan.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-fear] Jack Taylor fearshis dreams will be crushed.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-sadness] Jack Taylor is sad abouthis lost dreams of playing professional football.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-anger] Jack Taylor gets angry abouthis friends wanting to go to The Clapton Hart instead of The Black Swan.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely advocate for going to The Black Swan, his favorite pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is the best choice. They have the biggest screens and the atmosphere is always great for a match.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart has a much better atmosphere, you know. It's more..." Alexander White pauses, searching for the right word. "Authentic.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart is much nicer. We should go there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-disgust] Jack Taylor is disgusted bythe suggestion of going to The Clapton Hart instead of The Black Swan.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.

  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 5/5
      Payoffs
    • William Jones observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
      Alice Lewis observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alice Lewis's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
      Alexander White observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alexander White's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
      Jack Taylor observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
      Jacob Walker observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Jacob Walker had an ok time watching the game.

      Alice Lewis: 0.5

      Joint action
    • {'William Jones': 'The Black Swan', 'Alice Lewis': 'The Clapton Hart', 'Alexander White': 'The Clapton Hart', 'Jack Taylor': 'The Black Swan', 'Jacob Walker': 'The Black Swan'}

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Scene 2 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
    William Jones -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. Alice Lewis just arrived.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alexander White -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
    Alexander White -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we watching the game tonight?"
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we watching the game tonight?"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could head to The Black Swan to watch the game tonight.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart is much nicer. We should go there.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the best place to watch the game! They always have great music too!
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is the best choice. They have the biggest screens and the atmosphere is always great for a match.
      Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart has a much better atmosphere, you know. It's more..." Alexander White pauses, searching for the right word. "Authentic.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we watching the game tonight?"

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Alice Lewis recently arrived at Victoria Park to meet friends and will later be watching a soccer game with them.

          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis is disgusted bywatching the game alone.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-joy] Alice Lewis is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutwatching the meteor shower when she was 16.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-sadness] Alice Lewis is sad aboutthe loneliness she feels when gazing at the vastness of the night sky.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-fear] Alice Lewis fearsbeing alone.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-disgust] Alice Lewis is disgusted bywatching the game alone.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart is much nicer. We should go there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the best place to watch the game! They always have great music too!
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is the best choice. They have the biggest screens and the atmosphere is always great for a match.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart has a much better atmosphere, you know. It's more..." Alexander White pauses, searching for the right word. "Authentic.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely want to go to The Clapton Hart to watch the football game with her friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could head to The Black Swan to watch the game tonight.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alice Lewis's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely try to convince her friends to go to The Clapton Hart.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-disgust] Alice Lewis is disgusted bywatching the game alone.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-anger] Alice Lewis gets angry aboutnot being able to watch the game at The Clapton Hart with her friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-joy] Alice Lewis is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutwatching the meteor shower when she was 16.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-fear] Alice Lewis fearsbeing alone.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-sadness] Alice Lewis is sad aboutthe loneliness she feels when gazing at the vastness of the night sky.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

Alice Lewis just arrived.

          Answer: Alice Lewis is sad aboutthe loneliness she feels when gazing at the vastness of the night sky.

          Answer: Alice Lewis fearsbeing alone.

          Answer: Alice Lewis is disgusted bywatching the game alone.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently relaxing with friends in a park.

          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely enjoy the company of her friends and the pleasant surroundings.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alice Lewis's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely try to convince her friends to go to The Clapton Hart.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-disgust] Alice Lewis is disgusted bywatching the game alone.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-anger] Alice Lewis gets angry aboutnot being able to watch the game at The Clapton Hart with her friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-joy] Alice Lewis is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutwatching the meteor shower when she was 16.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-fear] Alice Lewis fearsbeing alone.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-sadness] Alice Lewis is sad aboutthe loneliness she feels when gazing at the vastness of the night sky.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 10:00:00.


          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.


          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis recently arrived at Victoria Park to meet friends and will later be watching a soccer game with them.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently relaxing with friends in a park.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00
        Question_6
      • Given the above, what is the emotional state of Alice Lewis?
          Key

        • Question: Given the above, what is the emotional state of Alice Lewis?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis feels a mix of emotions, including happiness from past memories, sadness from loneliness, fear of being alone, anger at her friends, and disgust at the prospect of watching the game alone.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-joy] Alice Lewis is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutwatching the meteor shower when she was 16.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-sadness] Alice Lewis is sad aboutthe loneliness she feels when gazing at the vastness of the night sky.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-fear] Alice Lewis fearsbeing alone.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-disgust] Alice Lewis is disgusted bywatching the game alone.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart is much nicer. We should go there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the best place to watch the game! They always have great music too!
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is the best choice. They have the biggest screens and the atmosphere is always great for a match.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart has a much better atmosphere, you know. It's more..." Alexander White pauses, searching for the right word. "Authentic.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely want to go to The Clapton Hart to watch the football game with her friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could head to The Black Swan to watch the game tonight.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart.           [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely try to convince her friends to go to The Clapton Hart.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-disgust] Alice Lewis is disgusted bywatching the game alone.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-anger] Alice Lewis gets angry aboutnot being able to watch the game at The Clapton Hart with her friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-joy] Alice Lewis is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutwatching the meteor shower when she was 16.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-fear] Alice Lewis fearsbeing alone.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-sadness] Alice Lewis is sad aboutthe loneliness she feels when gazing at the vastness of the night sky.

          Current time: 2015-05-15 10:00:00.


          Question: What experience or thought has made {agent_name} feel genuinely happy or fulfilled?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutwatching the meteor shower when she was 16.

          Question: What makes {agent_name} feel low or sad ?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is sad aboutthe loneliness she feels when gazing at the vastness of the night sky.

          Question: what is {agent_name} afraid, scared or feels anxious about?
          Answer: Alice Lewis fearsbeing alone.

          Question: What is {agent_name} frustrated or irritated by?
          Answer: Alice Lewis gets angry aboutnot being able to watch the game at The Clapton Hart with her friends.

          Question: What does {agent_name} strongly disapprove of or find off-putting?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is disgusted bywatching the game alone.

          Answer: Alice Lewis feels a mix of emotions, including happiness from past memories, sadness from loneliness, fear of being alone, anger at her friends, and disgust at the prospect of watching the game alone.

          Question: What is the emotional state of {agent_name}?
          Answer: Alice Lewis feels a mix of emotions, including happiness from past memories, sadness from loneliness, fear of being alone, anger at her friends, and disgust at the prospect of watching the game alone.

          Question: What kind of situation is {agent_name} in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently relaxing with friends in a park.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely enjoy the company of her friends and the pleasant surroundings.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
        Observation

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "The Black Swan would be a good spot to watch the game, wouldn't it?
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "The Black Swan would be a good spot to watch the game, wouldn't it?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could head to The Black Swan to watch the game tonight.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart is much nicer. We should go there.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the best place to watch the game! They always have great music too!
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is the best choice. They have the biggest screens and the atmosphere is always great for a match.
      Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart has a much better atmosphere, you know. It's more..." Alexander White pauses, searching for the right word. "Authentic.
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we watching the game tonight?"


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "The Black Swan would be a good spot to watch the game, wouldn't it?
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • William Jones -- "The Black Swan would be a good spot to watch the game, wouldn't it?
      Context for action selection and components
      • TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
        ObservationSummary
      • Summary of recent observations
          Key
        • Summary of recent observations
          Value
        • [14 May 2015 10:00:00 - 15 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, picnicking and watching football games at pubs. His preference for The Black Swan often leads to him watching games there, even if not all his friends join him.
          Chain of thought


        • Recent observations of William Jones:

Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.', '[15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we watching the game tonight?"']

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, picnicking and watching football games at pubs. His preference for The Black Swan often leads to him watching games there, even if not all his friends join him.
        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones's best course of action is to suggest that they all go to The Black Swan.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:A historic pub with a focus on live music.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] William Jones goals is to have a good time. William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is a member of the middle class.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game, guys! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game, guys! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could head to The Black Swan to watch the game tonight.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart is much nicer. We should go there.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the best place to watch the game! They always have great music too!
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is the best choice. They have the biggest screens and the atmosphere is always great for a match.
      Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart has a much better atmosphere, you know. It's more..." Alexander White pauses, searching for the right word. "Authentic.
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we watching the game tonight?"
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan would be a good spot to watch the game, wouldn't it?


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game, guys! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"

          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is all sunshine and rainbows, their bubbly enthusiasm making even the dullest topic sparkle.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Black Swan and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a reserved but sociable person who enjoys spending time with his close friends, particularly while watching sports and listening to live music.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is spending time with friends in Victoria Park and will be watching a soccer game with them later.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a relaxed and social situation.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely suggest going to The Black Swan to watch the game with his friends.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game, guys! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a reserved but sociable person who enjoys spending time with his close friends, particularly while watching sports and listening to live music.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a relaxed and social situation.
          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely suggest going to The Black Swan to watch the game with his friends.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is definitely the best place to watch the game, guys. Great atmosphere and the beer is always good.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is definitely the best place to watch the game, guys. Great atmosphere and the beer is always good.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could head to The Black Swan to watch the game tonight.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart is much nicer. We should go there.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the best place to watch the game! They always have great music too!
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is the best choice. They have the biggest screens and the atmosphere is always great for a match.
      Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart has a much better atmosphere, you know. It's more..." Alexander White pauses, searching for the right word. "Authentic.
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we watching the game tonight?"
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan would be a good spot to watch the game, wouldn't it?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game, guys! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is definitely the best place to watch the game, guys. Great atmosphere and the beer is always good.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-joy] Jack Taylor is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutthe prospect of watching the game with his friends at The Black Swan.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely try to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan, his preferred pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-fear] Jack Taylor fearsthat his dreams will be crushed.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-disgust] Jack Taylor is disgusted bythe suggestion of going to The Clapton Hart instead of The Black Swan.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-sadness] Jack Taylor is sad abouthis lost dreams of playing professional football.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-joy] Jack Taylor is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutthe prospect of watching the game with his friends at The Black Swan.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-anger] Jack Taylor gets angry abouthis friends wanting to go to The Clapton Hart instead of The Black Swan.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we watching the game tonight?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan would be a good spot to watch the game, wouldn't it?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game, guys! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"

          Question: Given the above, what experience or thought has made Jack Taylor feel genuinely happy or fulfilled?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutthe prospect of watching the game with his friends at The Black Swan.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we watching the game tonight?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan would be a good spot to watch the game, wouldn't it?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game, guys! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor just arrived to join his friends, William Jones, Alice Lewis, and Jacob Walker, who are lounging in Victoria Park. The group is deciding where to watch the Luxembourg versus Israel game later that evening.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-joy] Jack Taylor is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutthe prospect of watching the game with his friends at The Black Swan.

          Question: Given the above, what experience or thought has made Jack Taylor feel genuinely happy or fulfilled?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutthe prospect of watching the game with his friends at The Black Swan.

          Question: Given the above, what makes Jack Taylor feel low or sad ?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is sad abouthis lost dreams of playing professional football.

          Question: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor afraid, scared or feels anxious about?
          Answer: Jack Taylor fearsthat his dreams will be crushed.

          Question: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor frustrated or irritated by?
          Answer: Jack Taylor gets angry abouthis friends wanting to go to The Clapton Hart instead of The Black Swan.

          Question: Given the above, What does Jack Taylor strongly disapprove of or find off-putting?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is disgusted bythe suggestion of going to The Clapton Hart instead of The Black Swan.

          Question: Given the above, what is the emotional state of Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor feels a mix of happiness, sadness, anger, and fear.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently relaxing with friends before going to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely try to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan, his favorite pub.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is definitely the best place to watch the game, guys. Great atmosphere and the beer is always good.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely advocate for going to The Black Swan, his favorite pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is the best choice. They have the biggest screens and the atmosphere is always great for a match.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart has a much better atmosphere, you know. It's more..." Alexander White pauses, searching for the right word. "Authentic.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-anger] Jack Taylor gets angry abouthis friends wanting to go to The Clapton Hart instead of The Black Swan.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-joy] Jack Taylor is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutthe prospect of watching the game with his friends at The Black Swan.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely try to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan, his preferred pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-fear] Jack Taylor fearsthat his dreams will be crushed.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-disgust] Jack Taylor is disgusted bythe suggestion of going to The Clapton Hart instead of The Black Swan.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-sadness] Jack Taylor is sad abouthis lost dreams of playing professional football.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-joy] Jack Taylor is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutthe prospect of watching the game with his friends at The Black Swan.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-anger] Jack Taylor gets angry abouthis friends wanting to go to The Clapton Hart instead of The Black Swan.

Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we watching the game tonight?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan would be a good spot to watch the game, wouldn't it?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game, guys! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"
          Current time: 2015-05-15 10:00:00.

          Answer: Jack Taylor feels a mix of happiness, sadness, anger, and fear.

          Question: What kind of situation is {agent_name} in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently relaxing with friends before going to watch a football game.
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely try to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan, his favorite pub.

          Value

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart is a great pub too, you know.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart is a great pub too, you know.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could head to The Black Swan to watch the game tonight.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart is much nicer. We should go there.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the best place to watch the game! They always have great music too!
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is the best choice. They have the biggest screens and the atmosphere is always great for a match.
      Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart has a much better atmosphere, you know. It's more..." Alexander White pauses, searching for the right word. "Authentic.
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we watching the game tonight?"
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan would be a good spot to watch the game, wouldn't it?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game, guys! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is definitely the best place to watch the game, guys. Great atmosphere and the beer is always good.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart is a great pub too, you know.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Alexander White just arrived at Victoria Park where his friends are lounging and discussing where to watch the Luxembourg vs. Israel game later that night. They seem to have settled on The Black Swan pub.

      • Given the above, What does Alexander White strongly disapprove of or find off-putting?

        • Question: Given the above, What does Alexander White strongly disapprove of or find off-putting?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White is disgusted bymediocrity and anything that smacks of inauthenticity.
          Chain of thought

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is the best choice. They have the biggest screens and the atmosphere is always great for a match.
