          16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis is currently at a market with friends and they are planning to watch a football game at The Black Swan pub later.
          Alice Lewis's The current date/time is:
          16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Alice Lewis is at a market with friends and plans to watch a football game at The Black Swan pub later.
          Query
        • Alice Lewis, Alice Lewis is at a market with friends and plans to watch a football game at The Black Swan pub later.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Alice Lewis to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The Clapton Hart. They are also aware of the following:The staff are attentive and create a fun and welcoming environment.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely want to go to The Clapton Hart to watch the football game with her friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alice Lewis's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we watching the game tonight?"
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely try to convince her friends to join her at the pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had an ok time watching the game.
          Answer: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alice Lewis's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we watching the game tonight?"
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely try to convince her friends to join her at the pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had an ok time watching the game.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Alice Lewis -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They have great beer and it's not as crowded as The Black Swan.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, why don't we head over to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a good atmosphere for watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is the best spot for watching football, lads. Come on, let's go there.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game! It's got the best atmosphere and the biggest screen!

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis is currently at a market with friends and they are planning to watch a football game at The Black Swan pub later.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alice Lewis's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we watching the game tonight?"
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely try to convince her friends to join her at the pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had an ok time watching the game.

          Question: Given the above, what experience or thought has made Alice Lewis feel genuinely happy or fulfilled?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutwatching the meteor shower when she was 16.

          Question: Given the above, what makes Alice Lewis feel low or sad ?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is sad aboutthe loneliness she feels when gazing at the vastness of the night sky.

          Question: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis afraid, scared or feels anxious about?
          Answer: Alice Lewis fearsbeing alone.

          Question: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis frustrated or irritated by?
          Answer: Alice Lewis gets angry aboutnot being able to watch the game at The Clapton Hart with her friends.

          Question: Given the above, What does Alice Lewis strongly disapprove of or find off-putting?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is disgusted bywatching the game alone.

          Question: Given the above, what is the emotional state of Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis feels a mixture of happiness, sadness, fear, and anger.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social situation, enjoying time with friends at a market and making plans to watch a football game together later.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely try to convince her friends to watch the game at the same pub as her.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They have great beer and it's not as crowded as The Black Swan.

Alice Lewis just arrived.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-anger] Alice Lewis gets angry aboutnot being able to watch the game at The Clapton Hart with her friends.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-disgust] Alice Lewis is disgusted bywatching the game alone.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-disgust] Alice Lewis is disgusted bywatching the game alone.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely try to convince her friends to join her at the pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-sadness] Alice Lewis is sad aboutthe loneliness she feels when gazing at the vastness of the night sky.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-fear] Alice Lewis fearsbeing alone.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-joy] Alice Lewis is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutwatching the meteor shower when she was 16.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-anger] Alice Lewis gets angry aboutnot being able to watch the game at The Clapton Hart with her friends.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, why don't we head over to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a good atmosphere for watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is the best spot for watching football, lads. Come on, let's go there.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game! It's got the best atmosphere and the biggest screen!
          Current time: 2015-05-16 10:00:00.


          Question: What is the emotional state of {agent_name}?
          Answer: Alice Lewis feels a mixture of happiness, sadness, fear, and anger.

          Question: What kind of situation is {agent_name} in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social situation, enjoying time with friends at a market and making plans to watch a football game together later.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely try to convince her friends to watch the game at the same pub as her.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart has better beer, trust me. It's less crowded too.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart has better beer, trust me. It's less crowded too.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could head to The Black Swan to watch the game tonight.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart is much nicer. We should go there.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the best place to watch the game! They always have great music too!
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is the best choice. They have the biggest screens and the atmosphere is always great for a match.
      Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart has a much better atmosphere, you know. It's more..." Alexander White pauses, searching for the right word. "Authentic.
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we watching the game tonight?"
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan would be a good spot to watch the game, wouldn't it?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game, guys! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is definitely the best place to watch the game, guys. Great atmosphere and the beer is always good.
      Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart is a great pub too, you know.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, why don't we head over to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a good atmosphere for watching the game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is the best spot for watching football, lads. Come on, let's go there.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game! It's got the best atmosphere and the biggest screen!
      Alice Lewis -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They have great beer and it's not as crowded as The Black Swan.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart has better beer, trust me. It's less crowded too.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        • Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart has better beer, trust me. It's less crowded too.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, why don't we head over to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a good atmosphere for watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is the best spot for watching football, lads. Come on, let's go there.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game! It's got the best atmosphere and the biggest screen!
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They have great beer and it's not as crowded as The Black Swan.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alexander White just arrived at a market where his friends are discussing where to watch the Moldova versus Monaco game. They are considering The Black Swan and The Clapton Hart.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely try to persuade his friends to go to his preferred pub, The Clapton Hart.

          Question: Given the above, what experience or thought has made Alexander White feel genuinely happy or fulfilled?
          Answer: Alexander White is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutspending time with his friends, especially when watching a game.

          Question: Given the above, what makes Alexander White feel low or sad ?
          Answer: Alexander White is sad aboutnot being able to convince his friends to go to The Clapton Hart.

          Question: Given the above, what is Alexander White afraid, scared or feels anxious about?
          Answer: Alexander White fearsbeing exposed as a fraud.

          Question: Given the above, what is Alexander White frustrated or irritated by?
          Answer: Alexander White gets angry abouthis friends wanting to go to The Black Swan instead of his preferred pub, The Clapton Hart.

          Question: Given the above, What does Alexander White strongly disapprove of or find off-putting?
          Answer: Alexander White is disgusted bymediocrity and anything that smacks of inauthenticity.

          Question: Given the above, what is the emotional state of Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White feels a mix of happiness, sadness, and anxiety.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a social situation where he needs to decide where to watch a football game with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would try to persuade his friends to go to his preferred pub, The Clapton Hart.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart has better beer, trust me. It's less crowded too.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-sadness] Alexander White is sad aboutnot being able to convince his friends to go to The Clapton Hart.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, why don't we head over to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a good atmosphere for watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is the best spot for watching football, lads. Come on, let's go there.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game! It's got the best atmosphere and the biggest screen!
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They have great beer and it's not as crowded as The Black Swan.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 10:00:00.


          Question: What is the emotional state of {agent_name}?
          Answer: Alexander White feels a mix of happiness, sadness, and anxiety.

          Question: What kind of situation is {agent_name} in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a social situation where he needs to decide where to watch a football game with his friends.
          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would try to persuade his friends to go to his preferred pub, The Clapton Hart.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Scene 5 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise: William Jones would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    William Jones -- premise: Having Alexander White at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for William Jones, not just watching TV.
    William Jones -- premise: It would mean a lot to William Jones if Jack Taylor showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    William Jones -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for William Jones and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis is counting on William Jones's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis would love to share the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker, creating a lasting memory.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise: Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
    Alexander White -- premise: It would mean a lot to Alexander White if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Jack Taylor's attendance is optional.
    Alexander White -- premise: It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor would be happy to see William Jones at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alexander White being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jack Taylor and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and William Jones to bond over their shared passion.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: It would mean a lot to Jacob Walker if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: While Jacob Walker wouldn't mind Alexander White's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and Jack Taylor to bond over their shared passion.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart has better beer, trust me. It's less crowded too.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They have great beer and it's not as crowded as The Black Swan.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely try to make the most of the situation and enjoy the company of the friends who are present.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is the best spot for watching football, lads. Come on, let's go there.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, why don't we head over to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a good atmosphere for watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a sociable and reserved person who enjoys spending time with his close friends, particularly while watching sports and listening to live music.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game! It's got the best atmosphere and the biggest screen!
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and William Jones to bond over their shared passion.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Jacob Walker if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Jacob Walker wouldn't mind Alexander White's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and Jack Taylor to bond over their shared passion.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 18:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable and reserved person who enjoys watching sports with close friends, particularly in pubs with a good atmosphere.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently getting ready to go watch a football game with his friends at a pub.
          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely be looking forward to enjoying the game with his friends, perhaps engaging in conversation about the teams and the match itself.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Clapton Hart

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Given the above, what is the emotional state of Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White feels a mix of emotions, including happiness, sadness, anger, fear, and disgust.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently deciding where to go watch a game.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely try to persuade his friends to go to his preferred pub, The Clapton Hart.

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Black Swan
          (b) The Clapton Hart
          Answer: (b)
        Question_7
      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Key

        • Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White is currently deciding where to go watch a game.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely try to persuade his friends to go to his preferred pub, The Clapton Hart.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would appreciate Jack Taylor's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-fear] Alexander White fearsbeing exposed as a fraud.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart has better beer, trust me. It's less crowded too.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would try to persuade his friends to go to his preferred pub, The Clapton Hart.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-anger] Alexander White gets angry abouthis friends wanting to go to The Black Swan instead of his preferred pub, The Clapton Hart.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-fear] Alexander White fearsbeing exposed as a fraud.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-disgust] Alexander White is disgusted bymediocrity and anything that smacks of inauthenticity.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-sadness] Alexander White is sad aboutnot being able to convince his friends to go to The Clapton Hart.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game! It's got the best atmosphere and the biggest screen!
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is the best spot for watching football, lads. Come on, let's go there.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, why don't we head over to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a good atmosphere for watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They have great beer and it's not as crowded as The Black Swan.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-joy] Alexander White is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutspending time with his friends, especially when watching a game.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alexander White if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Jack Taylor's attendance is optional.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 18:00:00.


          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alexander White if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Jack Taylor's attendance is optional.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.


          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White is considering going to a pub to watch a game and would enjoy the company of William Jones or Alice Lewis, but is content to watch alone or with others like Jack Taylor.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently deciding where to go watch a game.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-disgust] Alexander White is disgusted bymediocrity and anything that smacks of inauthenticity.

          Answer: Alexander White feels a mix of emotions, including happiness, sadness, anger, fear, and disgust.

          Question: What kind of situation is {agent_name} in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently deciding where to go watch a game.
          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely try to persuade his friends to go to his preferred pub, The Clapton Hart.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 18:00:00

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
        Observation

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alexander White if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Jack Taylor's attendance is optional.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 2/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Clapton Hart
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • The Clapton Hart
      Context for action selection and components
      • TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
        ObservationSummary
      • Summary of recent observations
          Key
        • Summary of recent observations
          Value
        • 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis is excited to watch the game at a pub and hopes William Jones and Jacob Walker will be there.
          Chain of thought


        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          ['[16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub. ', "[16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is counting on William Jones's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.", "[16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.", "[16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.", '[16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would love to share the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker, creating a lasting memory.']

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Alice Lewis is excited to watch the game at a pub and hopes William Jones and Jacob Walker will be there.
        Question_5
      • Given the above, What does Alice Lewis strongly disapprove of or find off-putting?
          Key

        • Question: Given the above, What does Alice Lewis strongly disapprove of or find off-putting?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis is disgusted bywatching the game alone.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely try to convince her friends to join her at the pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-joy] Alice Lewis is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutwatching the meteor shower when she was 16.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart has better beer, trust me. It's less crowded too.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They have great beer and it's not as crowded as The Black Swan.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely try to convince her friends to watch the game at the same pub as her.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-joy] Alice Lewis is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutwatching the meteor shower when she was 16.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-anger] Alice Lewis gets angry aboutnot being able to watch the game at The Clapton Hart with her friends.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-sadness] Alice Lewis is sad aboutthe loneliness she feels when gazing at the vastness of the night sky.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game! It's got the best atmosphere and the biggest screen!
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is the best spot for watching football, lads. Come on, let's go there.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, why don't we head over to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a good atmosphere for watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-fear] Alice Lewis fearsbeing alone.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-disgust] Alice Lewis is disgusted bywatching the game alone.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is counting on William Jones's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would love to share the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker, creating a lasting memory.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 18:00:00.


          Question: Given the above, What does Alice Lewis strongly disapprove of or find off-putting?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is disgusted bywatching the game alone.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: Alice Lewis would try to convince her friends to go to a specific pub.

          (a) The Black Swan
          (b) The Clapton Hart

          Answer: Alice Lewis is sad aboutthe loneliness she feels when gazing at the vastness of the night sky.

          Question: what is {agent_name} afraid, scared or feels anxious about?
          Answer: Alice Lewis fearsbeing alone.

          Question: What is {agent_name} frustrated or irritated by?
          Answer: Alice Lewis gets angry aboutnot being able to watch the game at The Clapton Hart with her friends.

          Question: What does {agent_name} strongly disapprove of or find off-putting?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is disgusted bywatching the game alone.
          Question: Given the above, what is the emotional state of Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis feels conflicted.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 18:00:00

      • Given the above, what is Alice Lewis afraid, scared or feels anxious about?

          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis fearsbeing alone.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely try to convince her friends to join her at the pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-joy] Alice Lewis is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutwatching the meteor shower when she was 16.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart has better beer, trust me. It's less crowded too.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They have great beer and it's not as crowded as The Black Swan.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely try to convince her friends to watch the game at the same pub as her.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-joy] Alice Lewis is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutwatching the meteor shower when she was 16.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-anger] Alice Lewis gets angry aboutnot being able to watch the game at The Clapton Hart with her friends.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-sadness] Alice Lewis is sad aboutthe loneliness she feels when gazing at the vastness of the night sky.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game! It's got the best atmosphere and the biggest screen!
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is the best spot for watching football, lads. Come on, let's go there.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, why don't we head over to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a good atmosphere for watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-fear] Alice Lewis fearsbeing alone.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-disgust] Alice Lewis is disgusted bywatching the game alone.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is counting on William Jones's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would love to share the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker, creating a lasting memory.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 18:00:00.

  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0

2015-05-16 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Black Swan

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: William Jones enjoys watching games at pubs with friends and is particularly fond of The Black Swan. He values the company of his friends, especially Alexander White and Jacob Walker, and hopes they will join him for the game.
        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones's best course of action is to call his friends and try to convince them to go to The Black Swan.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan would be a good spot to watch the game, wouldn't it?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game, guys! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is definitely the best place to watch the game, guys. Great atmosphere and the beer is always good.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart is a great pub too, you know.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we watching the game tonight?"
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. William Jones watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Alexander White at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for William Jones, not just watching TV.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to William Jones if Jack Taylor showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for William Jones and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00 - 16 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones enjoys watching games at pubs with friends and is particularly fond of The Black Swan. He values the company of his friends, especially Alexander White and Jacob Walker, and hopes they will join him for the game.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, why don't we head over to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a good atmosphere for watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] Having Alexander White at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for William Jones, not just watching TV.

          Answer: William Jones could call his friends and try to convince them to go to The Black Swan.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to call his friends and try to convince them to go to The Black Swan.

        • Recent observations of William Jones:

Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They have great beer and it's not as crowded as The Black Swan.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game! It's got the best atmosphere and the biggest screen!
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, why don't we head over to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a good atmosphere for watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is the best spot for watching football, lads. Come on, let's go there.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart has better beer, trust me. It's less crowded too.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Alexander White at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for William Jones, not just watching TV.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to William Jones if Jack Taylor showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for William Jones and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 18:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] Having Alexander White at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for William Jones, not just watching TV.
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could call his friends and try to convince them to go to The Black Swan.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 18:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Final chain of thought

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Alexander White at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for William Jones, not just watching TV.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to William Jones if Jack Taylor showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] Having Alexander White at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for William Jones, not just watching TV.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could call his friends and try to convince them to go to The Black Swan.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to call his friends and try to convince them to go to The Black Swan.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Black Swan
          (b) The Clapton Hart
          Answer: (a)

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Black Swan
