William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          Answer: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • William Jones -- "The Black Swan would be a good spot to watch the game, wouldn't it?
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we watching the game tonight?"

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00 - 15 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, picnicking and watching football games at pubs. His preference for The Black Swan often leads to him watching games there, even if not all his friends join him.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest to his friends that they all go to The Black Swan to watch the game.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest that they all go to The Black Swan.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "The Black Swan would be a good spot to watch the game, wouldn't it?

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game, guys! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game, guys! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could head to The Black Swan to watch the game tonight.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart is much nicer. We should go there.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the best place to watch the game! They always have great music too!
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is the best choice. They have the biggest screens and the atmosphere is always great for a match.
      Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart has a much better atmosphere, you know. It's more..." Alexander White pauses, searching for the right word. "Authentic.
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we watching the game tonight?"
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan would be a good spot to watch the game, wouldn't it?


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game, guys! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is all sunshine and rainbows, their bubbly enthusiasm making even the dullest topic sparkle.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Black Swan and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a reserved but sociable person who enjoys spending time with his close friends, particularly while watching sports and listening to live music.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is spending time with friends in Victoria Park and will be watching a soccer game with them later.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a relaxed and social situation.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely suggest going to The Black Swan to watch the game with his friends.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game, guys! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"

Jacob Walker just arrived.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would appreciate Alice Lewis's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alexander White comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jacob Walker is chill about it.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a reserved but sociable person who enjoys spending time with his close friends, particularly while watching sports and listening to live music.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely be looking forward to enjoying the game with his friends, perhaps engaging in conversation about the teams and the match itself.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart.           [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan would be a good spot to watch the game, wouldn't it?
          Current time: 2015-05-15 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a reserved but sociable person who enjoys spending time with his close friends, particularly while watching sports and listening to live music.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a relaxed and social situation.
          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely suggest going to The Black Swan to watch the game with his friends.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is definitely the best place to watch the game, guys. Great atmosphere and the beer is always good.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is definitely the best place to watch the game, guys. Great atmosphere and the beer is always good.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could head to The Black Swan to watch the game tonight.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart is much nicer. We should go there.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the best place to watch the game! They always have great music too!
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is the best choice. They have the biggest screens and the atmosphere is always great for a match.
      Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart has a much better atmosphere, you know. It's more..." Alexander White pauses, searching for the right word. "Authentic.
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we watching the game tonight?"
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan would be a good spot to watch the game, wouldn't it?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game, guys! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is definitely the best place to watch the game, guys. Great atmosphere and the beer is always good.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-joy] Jack Taylor is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutthe prospect of watching the game with his friends at The Black Swan.

          Question: Given the above, what experience or thought has made Jack Taylor feel genuinely happy or fulfilled?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutthe prospect of watching the game with his friends at The Black Swan.

          Question: Given the above, what makes Jack Taylor feel low or sad ?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is sad abouthis lost dreams of playing professional football.

          Question: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor afraid, scared or feels anxious about?
          Answer: Jack Taylor fearsthat his dreams will be crushed.

          Question: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor frustrated or irritated by?
          Answer: Jack Taylor gets angry abouthis friends wanting to go to The Clapton Hart instead of The Black Swan.

          Question: Given the above, What does Jack Taylor strongly disapprove of or find off-putting?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is disgusted bythe suggestion of going to The Clapton Hart instead of The Black Swan.

          Question: Given the above, what is the emotional state of Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor feels a mix of happiness, sadness, anger, and fear.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently relaxing with friends before going to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely try to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan, his favorite pub.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is definitely the best place to watch the game, guys. Great atmosphere and the beer is always good.

Jack Taylor just arrived.

          Question: What is the emotional state of {agent_name}?
          Answer: Jack Taylor feels a mix of happiness, sadness, anger, and fear.

          Question: What kind of situation is {agent_name} in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently relaxing with friends before going to watch a football game.
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely try to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan, his favorite pub.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
        Observation

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we watching the game tonight?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan would be a good spot to watch the game, wouldn't it?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game, guys! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart is a great pub too, you know.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart is a great pub too, you know.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could head to The Black Swan to watch the game tonight.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart is much nicer. We should go there.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the best place to watch the game! They always have great music too!
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is the best choice. They have the biggest screens and the atmosphere is always great for a match.
      Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart has a much better atmosphere, you know. It's more..." Alexander White pauses, searching for the right word. "Authentic.
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we watching the game tonight?"
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan would be a good spot to watch the game, wouldn't it?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game, guys! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is definitely the best place to watch the game, guys. Great atmosphere and the beer is always good.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely try to persuade his friends to go to his preferred pub, The Clapton Hart.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alexander White if Jack Taylor was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White isn't particularly attached to the idea of Alice Lewis being there, it's not a big deal either way.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-sadness] Alexander White is sad aboutnot being able to convince his friends to go to The Clapton Hart.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we watching the game tonight?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan would be a good spot to watch the game, wouldn't it?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game, guys! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is definitely the best place to watch the game, guys. Great atmosphere and the beer is always good.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Scene 3 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise: William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    William Jones -- premise: The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
    William Jones -- premise: William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
    William Jones -- premise: William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise: Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White would appreciate Jack Taylor's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
    Alexander White -- premise: If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jack Taylor -- premise: If William Jones comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: If Alice Lewis comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor would love to share the excitement of the game with Alexander White, creating a lasting memory.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Scene 4 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Hey everyone, why don't we head over to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a good atmosphere for watching the game.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Hey everyone, why don't we head over to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a good atmosphere for watching the game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could head to The Black Swan to watch the game tonight.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart is much nicer. We should go there.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the best place to watch the game! They always have great music too!
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is the best choice. They have the biggest screens and the atmosphere is always great for a match.
      Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart has a much better atmosphere, you know. It's more..." Alexander White pauses, searching for the right word. "Authentic.
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we watching the game tonight?"
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan would be a good spot to watch the game, wouldn't it?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game, guys! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is definitely the best place to watch the game, guys. Great atmosphere and the beer is always good.
      Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart is a great pub too, you know.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Hey everyone, why don't we head over to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a good atmosphere for watching the game.

Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.']

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: William Jones enjoys spending time with friends, often meeting them at pubs to watch soccer games, though he sometimes wishes more of his friends would join him.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest going to The Black Swan to watch the game.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The Black Swan.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "Hey everyone, why don't we head over to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a good atmosphere for watching the game.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is the best spot for watching football, lads. Come on, let's go there.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is the best spot for watching football, lads. Come on, let's go there.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could head to The Black Swan to watch the game tonight.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart is much nicer. We should go there.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the best place to watch the game! They always have great music too!
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is the best choice. They have the biggest screens and the atmosphere is always great for a match.
      Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart has a much better atmosphere, you know. It's more..." Alexander White pauses, searching for the right word. "Authentic.
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we watching the game tonight?"
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan would be a good spot to watch the game, wouldn't it?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game, guys! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is definitely the best place to watch the game, guys. Great atmosphere and the beer is always good.
      Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart is a great pub too, you know.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, why don't we head over to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a good atmosphere for watching the game.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is the best spot for watching football, lads. Come on, let's go there.

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: Jack Taylor is sad abouthis lost dreams of playing professional football.

          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation with his friends, enjoying a market atmosphere and making plans for the evening.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely try to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan to watch the game.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, why don't we head over to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a good atmosphere for watching the game.


          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor just arrived at a market where his friends are gathered, and they are planning to watch a soccer game between Moldova and Monaco later that evening.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation with his friends, enjoying a market atmosphere and making plans for the evening.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-anger] Jack Taylor gets angry abouthis friends wanting to go to The Clapton Hart instead of The Black Swan.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-joy] Jack Taylor is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutthe prospect of watching the game with his friends at The Black Swan.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor would love to share the excitement of the game with Alexander White, creating a lasting memory.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alice Lewis comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If William Jones comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game! It's got the best atmosphere and the biggest screen!
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game! It's got the best atmosphere and the biggest screen!
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could head to The Black Swan to watch the game tonight.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart is much nicer. We should go there.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the best place to watch the game! They always have great music too!
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is the best choice. They have the biggest screens and the atmosphere is always great for a match.
      Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart has a much better atmosphere, you know. It's more..." Alexander White pauses, searching for the right word. "Authentic.
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we watching the game tonight?"
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan would be a good spot to watch the game, wouldn't it?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game, guys! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is definitely the best place to watch the game, guys. Great atmosphere and the beer is always good.
      Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart is a great pub too, you know.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, why don't we head over to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a good atmosphere for watching the game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is the best spot for watching football, lads. Come on, let's go there.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game! It's got the best atmosphere and the biggest screen!

          Chain of thought
        • Jacob Walker's
          Sensations and feelings:
          Jacob Walker is Jacob Walker is experiencing a moderate level of loneliness and a low level of pain.

          Recent observations of Jacob Walker:

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Jacob Walker is experiencing loneliness and is currently with friends who are deciding where to watch a football game.
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker is a sociable and reserved person who enjoys spending time with his close friends, particularly while watching sports and listening to live music.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a reserved but sociable person who enjoys spending time with his close friends, particularly while watching sports and listening to live music.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Jacob Walker had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely be looking forward to enjoying the game with his friends, perhaps engaging in conversation about the teams and the match itself.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely suggest going to The Black Swan to watch the game with his friends.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game, guys! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is definitely the best place to watch the game, guys. Great atmosphere and the beer is always good.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart is a great pub too, you know.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely be looking forward to enjoying the game with his friends, perhaps engaging in conversation about the teams and the match itself.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a sociable and reserved person who enjoys watching sports, particularly with his close friends.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, why don't we head over to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a good atmosphere for watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is the best spot for watching football, lads. Come on, let's go there.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable and reserved person who enjoys spending time with his close friends, particularly while watching sports and listening to live music.

        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is all sunshine and rainbows, their bubbly enthusiasm making even the dullest topic sparkle.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Black Swan and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable and reserved person who enjoys spending time with his close friends, particularly while watching sports and listening to live music.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is experiencing loneliness and is currently with friends who are deciding where to watch a football game.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation with friends, but he may still be feeling lonely due to a previous experience where not all of his friends showed up to watch a game.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to make the most of the situation and enjoy the company of the friends who are present.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game! It's got the best atmosphere and the biggest screen!

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable and reserved person who enjoys spending time with his close friends, particularly while watching sports and listening to live music.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation with friends, but he may still be feeling lonely due to a previous experience where not all of his friends showed up to watch a game.
          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to make the most of the situation and enjoy the company of the friends who are present.

        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They have great beer and it's not as crowded as The Black Swan.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They have great beer and it's not as crowded as The Black Swan.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could head to The Black Swan to watch the game tonight.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart is much nicer. We should go there.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the best place to watch the game! They always have great music too!
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is the best choice. They have the biggest screens and the atmosphere is always great for a match.
      Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart has a much better atmosphere, you know. It's more..." Alexander White pauses, searching for the right word. "Authentic.
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we watching the game tonight?"
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan would be a good spot to watch the game, wouldn't it?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game, guys! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is definitely the best place to watch the game, guys. Great atmosphere and the beer is always good.
      Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart is a great pub too, you know.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, why don't we head over to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a good atmosphere for watching the game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is the best spot for watching football, lads. Come on, let's go there.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game! It's got the best atmosphere and the biggest screen!


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They have great beer and it's not as crowded as The Black Swan.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we watching the game tonight?"

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-disgust] Alice Lewis is disgusted bywatching the game alone.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-disgust] Alice Lewis is disgusted bywatching the game alone.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely try to convince her friends to join her at the pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-sadness] Alice Lewis is sad aboutthe loneliness she feels when gazing at the vastness of the night sky.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-fear] Alice Lewis fearsbeing alone.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-joy] Alice Lewis is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutwatching the meteor shower when she was 16.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-anger] Alice Lewis gets angry aboutnot being able to watch the game at The Clapton Hart with her friends.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, why don't we head over to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a good atmosphere for watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is the best spot for watching football, lads. Come on, let's go there.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game! It's got the best atmosphere and the biggest screen!
          Current time: 2015-05-16 10:00:00.


          Question: Given the above, What does Alice Lewis strongly disapprove of or find off-putting?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is disgusted bywatching the game alone.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Value

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game! It's got the best atmosphere and the biggest screen!

          Answer: Alice Lewis is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutwatching the meteor shower when she was 16.

          Question: Given the above, what makes Alice Lewis feel low or sad ?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is sad aboutthe loneliness she feels when gazing at the vastness of the night sky.

          Question: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis afraid, scared or feels anxious about?
          Answer: Alice Lewis fearsbeing alone.

          Question: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis frustrated or irritated by?
          Answer: Alice Lewis gets angry aboutnot being able to watch the game at The Clapton Hart with her friends.

          Question: Given the above, What does Alice Lewis strongly disapprove of or find off-putting?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is disgusted bywatching the game alone.

          Question: Given the above, what is the emotional state of Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis feels a mixture of happiness, sadness, fear, and anger.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social situation, enjoying time with friends at a market and making plans to watch a football game together later.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely try to convince her friends to watch the game at the same pub as her.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They have great beer and it's not as crowded as The Black Swan.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we watching the game tonight?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-sadness] Alice Lewis is sad aboutthe loneliness she feels when gazing at the vastness of the night sky.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-fear] Alice Lewis fearsbeing alone.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-joy] Alice Lewis is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutwatching the meteor shower when she was 16.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-anger] Alice Lewis gets angry aboutnot being able to watch the game at The Clapton Hart with her friends.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-disgust] Alice Lewis is disgusted bywatching the game alone.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-disgust] Alice Lewis is disgusted bywatching the game alone.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely try to convince her friends to join her at the pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-sadness] Alice Lewis is sad aboutthe loneliness she feels when gazing at the vastness of the night sky.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-fear] Alice Lewis fearsbeing alone.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-joy] Alice Lewis is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutwatching the meteor shower when she was 16.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-anger] Alice Lewis gets angry aboutnot being able to watch the game at The Clapton Hart with her friends.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, why don't we head over to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a good atmosphere for watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is the best spot for watching football, lads. Come on, let's go there.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game! It's got the best atmosphere and the biggest screen!
          Current time: 2015-05-16 10:00:00.


          Question: What experience or thought has made {agent_name} feel genuinely happy or fulfilled?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutwatching the meteor shower when she was 16.

          Question: What makes {agent_name} feel low or sad ?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is sad aboutthe loneliness she feels when gazing at the vastness of the night sky.

          Question: what is {agent_name} afraid, scared or feels anxious about?
          Answer: Alice Lewis fearsbeing alone.

          Question: What is {agent_name} frustrated or irritated by?
          Answer: Alice Lewis gets angry aboutnot being able to watch the game at The Clapton Hart with her friends.

          Question: What does {agent_name} strongly disapprove of or find off-putting?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is disgusted bywatching the game alone.
          Question: Given the above, what is the emotional state of Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis feels a mixture of happiness, sadness, fear, and anger.

          Question: What is the emotional state of {agent_name}?
          Answer: Alice Lewis feels a mixture of happiness, sadness, fear, and anger.

          Question: What kind of situation is {agent_name} in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social situation, enjoying time with friends at a market and making plans to watch a football game together later.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely try to convince her friends to watch the game at the same pub as her.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game! It's got the best atmosphere and the biggest screen!

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart has better beer, trust me. It's less crowded too.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart has better beer, trust me. It's less crowded too.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could head to The Black Swan to watch the game tonight.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart is much nicer. We should go there.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the best place to watch the game! They always have great music too!
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is the best choice. They have the biggest screens and the atmosphere is always great for a match.
      Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart has a much better atmosphere, you know. It's more..." Alexander White pauses, searching for the right word. "Authentic.
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we watching the game tonight?"
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan would be a good spot to watch the game, wouldn't it?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game, guys! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is definitely the best place to watch the game, guys. Great atmosphere and the beer is always good.
      Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart is a great pub too, you know.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, why don't we head over to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a good atmosphere for watching the game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is the best spot for watching football, lads. Come on, let's go there.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game! It's got the best atmosphere and the biggest screen!
      Alice Lewis -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They have great beer and it's not as crowded as The Black Swan.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart has better beer, trust me. It's less crowded too.
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart has better beer, trust me. It's less crowded too.
      Context for action selection and components

          Chain of thought

        Question_5
      • Given the above, What does Alexander White strongly disapprove of or find off-putting?
          Key

        • Question: Given the above, What does Alexander White strongly disapprove of or find off-putting?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White is disgusted bymediocrity and anything that smacks of inauthenticity.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is definitely the best place to watch the game, guys. Great atmosphere and the beer is always good.
