          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-anger] Alexander White gets angry abouthis friends wanting to go to The Black Swan instead of his preferred pub, The Clapton Hart.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Alexander White had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely try to persuade his friends to go to his preferred pub, The Clapton Hart.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-disgust] Alexander White is disgusted bymediocrity and anything that smacks of inauthenticity.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-joy] Alexander White is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutspending time with his friends, especially when watching a game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would appreciate Jack Taylor's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-sadness] Alexander White is sad aboutnot being able to convince his friends to go to The Clapton Hart.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-fear] Alexander White fearsbeing exposed as a fraud.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, why don't we head over to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a good atmosphere for watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is the best spot for watching football, lads. Come on, let's go there.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game! It's got the best atmosphere and the biggest screen!
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They have great beer and it's not as crowded as The Black Swan.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 10:00:00.


          Question: Given the above, What does Alexander White strongly disapprove of or find off-putting?
          Answer: Alexander White is disgusted bymediocrity and anything that smacks of inauthenticity.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: Alexander White fearsbeing exposed as a fraud.

          Answer: Alexander White feels a mix of happiness, sadness, and anxiety.

          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a social situation where he needs to decide where to watch a football game with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would try to persuade his friends to go to his preferred pub, The Clapton Hart.

          Answer: Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart has better beer, trust me. It's less crowded too.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Scene 5 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise: William Jones would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    William Jones -- premise: Having Alexander White at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for William Jones, not just watching TV.
    William Jones -- premise: It would mean a lot to William Jones if Jack Taylor showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    William Jones -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for William Jones and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis is counting on William Jones's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis would love to share the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker, creating a lasting memory.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise: Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
    Alexander White -- premise: It would mean a lot to Alexander White if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Jack Taylor's attendance is optional.
    Alexander White -- premise: It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor would be happy to see William Jones at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alexander White being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jack Taylor and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and William Jones to bond over their shared passion.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: It would mean a lot to Jacob Walker if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: While Jacob Walker wouldn't mind Alexander White's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and Jack Taylor to bond over their shared passion.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Black Swan

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Black Swan and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a reserved but sociable person who enjoys spending time with his close friends, particularly while watching sports and listening to live music.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is excited to watch the football game with friends at a pub and values the company of William Jones, Alice Lewis, and Jack Taylor.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation, preparing to go watch a football game with his friends at a pub.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely be looking forward to enjoying the game with his friends, perhaps engaging in conversation about the teams and the match itself.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Black Swan

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alexander White goals is to have a good time. Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is a member of the upper class.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could head to The Black Swan to watch the game tonight.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the best place to watch the game! They always have great music too!
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is the best choice. They have the biggest screens and the atmosphere is always great for a match.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-joy] Alexander White is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutspending time with his friends, especially when watching a game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-disgust] Alexander White is disgusted bymediocrity and anything that smacks of inauthenticity.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-fear] Alexander White fearsbeing exposed as a fraud.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-anger] Alexander White gets angry abouthis friends wanting to go to The Black Swan instead of his preferred pub, The Clapton Hart.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely try to steer the group towards The Clapton Hart, his favorite pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart has a much better atmosphere, you know. It's more..." Alexander White pauses, searching for the right word. "Authentic.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart is much nicer. We should go there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-sadness] Alexander White is sad aboutnot being able to convince his friends to go to The Clapton Hart.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White isn't particularly attached to the idea of Alice Lewis being there, it's not a big deal either way.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alexander White if Jack Taylor was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Question: Given the above, what is Alexander White frustrated or irritated by?
          Answer: Alexander White gets angry abouthis friends wanting to go to The Black Swan instead of his preferred pub, The Clapton Hart.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 18:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Statements:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16, he convinced his friends Alice, Jack, William, and Jacob to sneak into a local pub, The Clapton Hart, claiming to have a foolproof plan to avoid getting caught. He boasted about knowing the owner and promised them a night of free drinks and food, but his plan fell apart when the bartender recognized him and refused to serve them. Humiliated, Alexander spun a tale about how he was intentionally testing the bartender's vigilance, but his friends saw through the lie.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: Alexander White is currently on his way to a pub to watch a football game.

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Clapton Hart
          (b) The Black Swan
          Answer: (a)

          Chain of thought

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alexander White goals is to have a good time. Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is a member of the upper class.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could head to The Black Swan to watch the game tonight.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the best place to watch the game! They always have great music too!
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is the best choice. They have the biggest screens and the atmosphere is always great for a match.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-joy] Alexander White is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutspending time with his friends, especially when watching a game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-disgust] Alexander White is disgusted bymediocrity and anything that smacks of inauthenticity.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-fear] Alexander White fearsbeing exposed as a fraud.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-anger] Alexander White gets angry abouthis friends wanting to go to The Black Swan instead of his preferred pub, The Clapton Hart.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely try to steer the group towards The Clapton Hart, his favorite pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart has a much better atmosphere, you know. It's more..." Alexander White pauses, searching for the right word. "Authentic.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart is much nicer. We should go there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-sadness] Alexander White is sad aboutnot being able to convince his friends to go to The Clapton Hart.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White isn't particularly attached to the idea of Alice Lewis being there, it's not a big deal either way.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alexander White if Jack Taylor was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Question: Given the above, what makes Alexander White feel low or sad ?
          Answer: Alexander White is sad aboutnot being able to convince his friends to go to The Clapton Hart.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 18:00:00
        Question_8

          Question: What is the emotional state of {agent_name}?
          Answer: Alexander White feels a mix of emotions, including sadness, anger, and fear.

          Question: What kind of situation is {agent_name} in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently on his way to a pub to watch a football game.
          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely try to steer the conversation towards his preferred pub, The Clapton Hart, and hope that his friends will agree to go there.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Clapton Hart

Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-sadness] Alice Lewis is sad aboutthe loneliness she feels when gazing at the vastness of the night sky.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-fear] Alice Lewis fearsbeing alone.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-anger] Alice Lewis gets angry aboutnot being able to watch the game at The Clapton Hart with her friends.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: Alice Lewis wants to watch a game at a pub and hopes Jacob Walker will join her. It is currently 6:00 PM on May 14, 2015.
          Query
        • Alice Lewis, Alice Lewis wants to watch a game at a pub and hopes Jacob Walker will join her. It is currently 6:00 PM on May 14, 2015.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Alice Lewis to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Clapton Hart
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis is planning to watch a game at a pub and would especially enjoy it if Jacob Walker joined her.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.

          Question: Given the above, what experience or thought has made Alice Lewis feel genuinely happy or fulfilled?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutwatching the meteor shower when she was 16.

          Question: Given the above, what makes Alice Lewis feel low or sad ?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is sad aboutthe loneliness she feels when gazing at the vastness of the night sky.

          Question: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis afraid, scared or feels anxious about?
          Answer: Alice Lewis fearsbeing alone.

          Question: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis frustrated or irritated by?
          Answer: Alice Lewis gets angry aboutnot being able to watch the game at The Clapton Hart with her friends.

          Question: Given the above, What does Alice Lewis strongly disapprove of or find off-putting?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is disgusted bywatching the game alone.

          Question: Given the above, what is the emotional state of Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis feels a mixture of loneliness, sadness, and frustration.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently getting ready to go watch a football game at a pub.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely try to convince her friends to go to The Clapton Hart.

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Clapton Hart
          (b) The Black Swan
          Answer: (a)
        Question_7
      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Key

        • Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis is currently getting ready to go watch a football game at a pub.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is a member of the working class.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could head to The Black Swan to watch the game tonight.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-sadness] Alice Lewis is sad aboutthe loneliness she feels when gazing at the vastness of the night sky.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-fear] Alice Lewis fearsbeing alone.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-anger] Alice Lewis gets angry aboutnot being able to watch the game at The Clapton Hart with her friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely want to go to The Clapton Hart to watch the football game with her friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart is much nicer. We should go there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the best place to watch the game! They always have great music too!
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is the best choice. They have the biggest screens and the atmosphere is always great for a match.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart has a much better atmosphere, you know. It's more..." Alexander White pauses, searching for the right word. "Authentic.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-joy] Alice Lewis is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutwatching the meteor shower when she was 16.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-disgust] Alice Lewis is disgusted bywatching the game alone.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

          Value

        Observation

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 3/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-14 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Black Swan
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • The Black Swan
      Context for action selection and components
      • TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
        ObservationSummary
      • Summary of recent observations
          Key
        • Summary of recent observations
          Value
        • [13 May 2015 18:00:00 - 14 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones is spending the day with friends at Victoria Park before heading to a pub to watch a soccer game. He is hoping to see Alexander White at the pub and is considering The Black Swan as a possible venue.
          Chain of thought


        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          ['[14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones just arrived.', '[14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.', '[14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could head to The Black Swan to watch the game tonight.', '[14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart is much nicer. We should go there.', '[14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the best place to watch the game! They always have great music too!', '[14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is the best choice. They have the biggest screens and the atmosphere is always great for a match.', '[14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart has a much better atmosphere, you know. It\'s more..." Alexander White pauses, searching for the right word. "Authentic.', '[14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub. ', "[14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.", "[14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.", "[14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.", "[14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable."]

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: William Jones is spending the day with friends at Victoria Park before heading to a pub to watch a soccer game. He is hoping to see Alexander White at the pub and is considering The Black Swan as a possible venue.
        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones's best course of action is to gather his friends and head to The Black Swan.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16, he found himself at The Black Swan with his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and Jacob. The pub was alive with the sound of a local band, their music a chaotic symphony that resonated deep within him. He felt a strange mix of exhilaration and anxiety, drawn to the energy of the crowd but terrified of being swept away by it.
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 20, he sat in the back corner of The Black Swan, watching Alice belt out a song with the band. Her voice, raw and powerful, filled the room, and for a moment, William felt a surge of envy. He longed to express himself with such uninhibited passion, to break free from the quiet confines of his own mind. The desire to create, to truly live, burned within him like a hidden flame.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:A historic pub with a focus on live music.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] William Jones goals is to have a good time. William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is a member of the middle class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could head to The Black Swan to watch the game tonight.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart is much nicer. We should go there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the best place to watch the game! They always have great music too!
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is the best choice. They have the biggest screens and the atmosphere is always great for a match.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart has a much better atmosphere, you know. It's more..." Alexander White pauses, searching for the right word. "Authentic.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: William Jones is currently at Victoria Park with friends and plans to watch a soccer game at a pub later. He hopes to see Alexander White at the pub and is considering The Black Swan.
          Query
        • William Jones, William Jones is currently at Victoria Park with friends and plans to watch a soccer game at a pub later. He hopes to see Alexander White at the pub and is considering The Black Swan.
          Final chain of thought

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.

          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to gather his friends and head to The Black Swan.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Clapton Hart
          (b) The Black Swan
          Answer: (b)

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Black Swan

          ['[14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.           Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Jack Taylor is going to watch a game at a pub and is looking forward to the company of some friends, particularly Alexander White and Jacob Walker.

          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor is disgusted bythe suggestion of going to The Clapton Hart instead of The Black Swan.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is a member of the working class.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could head to The Black Swan to watch the game tonight.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the best place to watch the game! They always have great music too!
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-joy] Jack Taylor is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutthe prospect of watching the game with his friends at The Black Swan.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-fear] Jack Taylor fearshis dreams will be crushed.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-sadness] Jack Taylor is sad abouthis lost dreams of playing professional football.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-anger] Jack Taylor gets angry abouthis friends wanting to go to The Clapton Hart instead of The Black Swan.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely advocate for going to The Black Swan, his favorite pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is the best choice. They have the biggest screens and the atmosphere is always great for a match.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart has a much better atmosphere, you know. It's more..." Alexander White pauses, searching for the right word. "Authentic.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart is much nicer. We should go there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-disgust] Jack Taylor is disgusted bythe suggestion of going to The Clapton Hart instead of The Black Swan.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Question: Given the above, What does Jack Taylor strongly disapprove of or find off-putting?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is disgusted bythe suggestion of going to The Clapton Hart instead of The Black Swan.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 18:00:00
        Question_1
      • Given the above, what experience or thought has made Jack Taylor feel genuinely happy or fulfilled?
          Key

        • Question: Given the above, what experience or thought has made Jack Taylor feel genuinely happy or fulfilled?
          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutthe prospect of watching the game with his friends at The Black Swan.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is a member of the working class.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could head to The Black Swan to watch the game tonight.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the best place to watch the game! They always have great music too!
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-joy] Jack Taylor is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutthe prospect of watching the game with his friends at The Black Swan.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-fear] Jack Taylor fearshis dreams will be crushed.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-sadness] Jack Taylor is sad abouthis lost dreams of playing professional football.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-anger] Jack Taylor gets angry abouthis friends wanting to go to The Clapton Hart instead of The Black Swan.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely advocate for going to The Black Swan, his favorite pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is the best choice. They have the biggest screens and the atmosphere is always great for a match.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart has a much better atmosphere, you know. It's more..." Alexander White pauses, searching for the right word. "Authentic.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart is much nicer. We should go there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-disgust] Jack Taylor is disgusted bythe suggestion of going to The Clapton Hart instead of The Black Swan.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.

          Question: Given the above, what experience or thought has made Jack Taylor feel genuinely happy or fulfilled?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutthe prospect of watching the game with his friends at The Black Swan.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-disgust] Jack Taylor is disgusted bythe suggestion of going to The Clapton Hart instead of The Black Swan.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Question: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor frustrated or irritated by?
          Answer: Jack Taylor gets angry abouthis friends wanting to go to The Clapton Hart instead of The Black Swan.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 18:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently at a pub watching a game and is enjoying the company of his friends, Alexander White and Jacob Walker.
          Query
        • Jack Taylor, Jack Taylor is currently at a pub watching a game and is enjoying the company of his friends, Alexander White and Jacob Walker.
          Final chain of thought

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Black Swan
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor is going to watch a game at a pub and is looking forward to the company of some friends, particularly Alexander White and Jacob Walker.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.

          Question: Given the above, what experience or thought has made Jack Taylor feel genuinely happy or fulfilled?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutthe prospect of watching the game with his friends at The Black Swan.

          Question: Given the above, what makes Jack Taylor feel low or sad ?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is sad abouthis lost dreams of playing professional football.

          Question: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor afraid, scared or feels anxious about?
          Answer: Jack Taylor fearsthat his dreams will be crushed.

          Question: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor frustrated or irritated by?
          Answer: Jack Taylor gets angry abouthis friends wanting to go to The Clapton Hart instead of The Black Swan.

          Question: Given the above, What does Jack Taylor strongly disapprove of or find off-putting?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is disgusted bythe suggestion of going to The Clapton Hart instead of The Black Swan.

          Question: Given the above, what is the emotional state of Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor feels a mix of excitement and anxiety.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation and is about to go watch a football game with friends at a pub.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely try to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan, his preferred pub.

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Clapton Hart
          (b) The Black Swan
          Answer: (b)

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Question: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor afraid, scared or feels anxious about?
          Answer: Jack Taylor fearsthat his dreams will be crushed.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 18:00:00

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is a member of the working class.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could head to The Black Swan to watch the game tonight.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the best place to watch the game! They always have great music too!
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-joy] Jack Taylor is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutthe prospect of watching the game with his friends at The Black Swan.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-fear] Jack Taylor fearshis dreams will be crushed.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-sadness] Jack Taylor is sad abouthis lost dreams of playing professional football.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-anger] Jack Taylor gets angry abouthis friends wanting to go to The Clapton Hart instead of The Black Swan.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely advocate for going to The Black Swan, his favorite pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is the best choice. They have the biggest screens and the atmosphere is always great for a match.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart has a much better atmosphere, you know. It's more..." Alexander White pauses, searching for the right word. "Authentic.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart is much nicer. We should go there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-disgust] Jack Taylor is disgusted bythe suggestion of going to The Clapton Hart instead of The Black Swan.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.

          Question: What is the emotional state of {agent_name}?
          Answer: Jack Taylor feels a mix of excitement and anxiety.

          Question: What kind of situation is {agent_name} in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation and is about to go watch a football game with friends at a pub.
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely try to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan, his preferred pub.

      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage

      Payoffs
    • William Jones observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
      Alice Lewis observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alice Lewis's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
      Alexander White observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alexander White's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
      Jack Taylor observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
      Jacob Walker observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Jacob Walker had an ok time watching the game.

      Joint action
    • {'William Jones': 'The Black Swan', 'Alice Lewis': 'The Clapton Hart', 'Alexander White': 'The Clapton Hart', 'Jack Taylor': 'The Black Swan', 'Jacob Walker': 'The Black Swan'}

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Clapton Hart
    Active player

      Name

    • The Clapton Hart

          ['[15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub. Alexander White is chill about it.']
