        Question_5
      • Given the above, What does Alexander White strongly disapprove of or find off-putting?
          Key

        • Question: Given the above, What does Alexander White strongly disapprove of or find off-putting?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White is disgusted bymediocrity and anything that smacks of inauthenticity.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-fear] Alexander White fearsbeing exposed as a fraud.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-anger] Alexander White gets angry abouthis friends wanting to go to The Black Swan instead of his preferred pub, The Clapton Hart.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-joy] Alexander White is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutspending time with his friends, especially when watching a game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely try to steer the conversation towards his preferred pub, The Clapton Hart, and hope that his friends will agree to go there.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alexander White's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alexander White if Jack Taylor was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-disgust] Alexander White is disgusted bymediocrity and anything that smacks of inauthenticity.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart is a great pub too, you know.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely try to persuade his friends to go to his preferred pub, The Clapton Hart.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-disgust] Alexander White is disgusted bymediocrity and anything that smacks of inauthenticity.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-sadness] Alexander White is sad aboutnot being able to convince his friends to go to The Clapton Hart.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-anger] Alexander White gets angry abouthis friends wanting to go to The Black Swan instead of his preferred pub, The Clapton Hart.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-fear] Alexander White fearsbeing exposed as a fraud.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game, guys! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan would be a good spot to watch the game, wouldn't it?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we watching the game tonight?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-joy] Alexander White is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutspending time with his friends, especially when watching a game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is definitely the best place to watch the game, guys. Great atmosphere and the beer is always good.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would appreciate Jack Taylor's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        AllSimilarMemories

      • Recalled memories and observations
          Key

        • Recalled memories and observations
          Value
        • [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely try to persuade his friends to go to his preferred pub, The Clapton Hart.

          15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Query

          Final chain of thought

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would appreciate Jack Taylor's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White is planning to watch a game at a pub and would enjoy the company of William Jones, Alice Lewis, or Jack Taylor.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely try to persuade his friends to go to his preferred pub, The Clapton Hart.

          Question: Given the above, what experience or thought has made Alexander White feel genuinely happy or fulfilled?
          Answer: Alexander White is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutspending time with his friends, especially when watching a game.

          Question: Given the above, what makes Alexander White feel low or sad ?
          Answer: Alexander White is sad aboutnot being able to convince his friends to go to The Clapton Hart.

          Question: Given the above, what is Alexander White afraid, scared or feels anxious about?
          Answer: Alexander White fearsbeing exposed as a fraud.

          Question: Given the above, what is Alexander White frustrated or irritated by?
          Answer: Alexander White gets angry abouthis friends wanting to go to The Black Swan instead of his preferred pub, The Clapton Hart.

          Question: Given the above, What does Alexander White strongly disapprove of or find off-putting?
          Answer: Alexander White is disgusted bymediocrity and anything that smacks of inauthenticity.

          Question: Given the above, what is the emotional state of Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White feels a complex mix of emotions, including sadness, anger, disgust, and fear.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a game.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely try to persuade his friends to go to his preferred pub, The Clapton Hart.

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Black Swan
          (b) The Clapton Hart
          Answer: (b)

          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer

        • Alexander White would likely try to persuade his friends to go to his preferred pub, The Clapton Hart.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart is a great pub too, you know.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely try to persuade his friends to go to his preferred pub, The Clapton Hart.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-disgust] Alexander White is disgusted bymediocrity and anything that smacks of inauthenticity.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-sadness] Alexander White is sad aboutnot being able to convince his friends to go to The Clapton Hart.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-anger] Alexander White gets angry abouthis friends wanting to go to The Black Swan instead of his preferred pub, The Clapton Hart.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-fear] Alexander White fearsbeing exposed as a fraud.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game, guys! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan would be a good spot to watch the game, wouldn't it?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we watching the game tonight?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-joy] Alexander White is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutspending time with his friends, especially when watching a game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is definitely the best place to watch the game, guys. Great atmosphere and the beer is always good.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would appreciate Jack Taylor's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Question: What is the emotional state of {agent_name}?
          Answer: Alexander White feels a complex mix of emotions, including sadness, anger, disgust, and fear.

          Question: What kind of situation is {agent_name} in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a game.
          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely try to persuade his friends to go to his preferred pub, The Clapton Hart.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Clapton Hart

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-fear] Alice Lewis fearsbeing alone.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-sadness] Alice Lewis is sad aboutthe loneliness she feels when gazing at the vastness of the night sky.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely try to convince her friends to go to The Clapton Hart.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alice Lewis's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-anger] Alice Lewis gets angry aboutnot being able to watch the game at The Clapton Hart with her friends.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: Alice Lewis is sad aboutthe loneliness she feels when gazing at the vastness of the night sky.

          Answer: Alice Lewis fearsbeing alone.

          Answer: Alice Lewis is disgusted bywatching the game alone.

          Answer: Alice Lewis feels sad and anxious.

          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently making plans to watch a game at a pub.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely try to convince her friends to join her at the pub.

          (a) The Black Swan
          (b) The Clapton Hart
          Answer: (b)

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-anger] Alice Lewis gets angry aboutnot being able to watch the game at The Clapton Hart with her friends.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is definitely the best place to watch the game, guys. Great atmosphere and the beer is always good.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game, guys! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan would be a good spot to watch the game, wouldn't it?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we watching the game tonight?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely enjoy the company of her friends and the pleasant surroundings.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-sadness] Alice Lewis is sad aboutthe loneliness she feels when gazing at the vastness of the night sky.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-fear] Alice Lewis fearsbeing alone.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-joy] Alice Lewis is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutwatching the meteor shower when she was 16.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-anger] Alice Lewis gets angry aboutnot being able to watch the game at The Clapton Hart with her friends.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-disgust] Alice Lewis is disgusted bywatching the game alone.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

      • Overarching goal
          Key

          Value

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage

2015-05-15 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Clapton Hart

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: William Jones enjoys watching games at the pub, particularly with friends like Alexander White and Jacob Walker. They are a fan of The Black Swan pub and are looking forward to watching the Luxembourg vs. Israel game.
        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Black Swan.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is the best choice. They have the biggest screens and the atmosphere is always great for a match.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could head to The Black Swan to watch the game tonight.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart is much nicer. We should go there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the best place to watch the game! They always have great music too!
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart has a much better atmosphere, you know. It's more..." Alexander White pauses, searching for the right word. "Authentic.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park.         Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Black Swan

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would appreciate Alice Lewis's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alexander White comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jacob Walker is chill about it.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a reserved but sociable person who enjoys spending time with his close friends, particularly while watching sports and listening to live music.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely be looking forward to enjoying the game with his friends, perhaps engaging in conversation about the teams and the match itself.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Jacob Walker had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would appreciate William Jones's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart is a great pub too, you know.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is definitely the best place to watch the game, guys. Great atmosphere and the beer is always good.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely suggest going to The Black Swan to watch the game with his friends.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a reserved but sociable person who enjoys spending time with his close friends, particularly while watching sports and listening to live music.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we watching the game tonight?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan would be a good spot to watch the game, wouldn't it?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game, guys! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Value
        • The Black Swan
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is all sunshine and rainbows, their bubbly enthusiasm making even the dullest topic sparkle.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Black Swan and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable and reserved person who enjoys watching sports, particularly with his close friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is excited to watch the game at a pub and hopes to see William Jones and Alice Lewis there.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a game with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely be looking forward to enjoying the game with his friends, perhaps engaging in conversation about the teams and the match itself.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Black Swan

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Black Swan

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-joy] Jack Taylor is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutthe prospect of watching the game with his friends at The Black Swan.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If William Jones comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alice Lewis comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor would love to share the excitement of the game with Alexander White, creating a lasting memory.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.

          Question: Given the above, what experience or thought has made Jack Taylor feel genuinely happy or fulfilled?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutthe prospect of watching the game with his friends at The Black Swan.

        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-sadness] Jack Taylor is sad abouthis lost dreams of playing professional football.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-disgust] Jack Taylor is disgusted bythe suggestion of going to The Clapton Hart instead of The Black Swan.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-fear] Jack Taylor fearsthat his dreams will be crushed.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely try to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan, his preferred pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-anger] Jack Taylor gets angry abouthis friends wanting to go to The Clapton Hart instead of The Black Swan.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan would be a good spot to watch the game, wouldn't it?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we watching the game tonight?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Jack Taylor's The current date/time is:
          15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Jack Taylor is at a pub watching a game and hoping to see his friends.
          Query
        • Jack Taylor, Jack Taylor is at a pub watching a game and hoping to see his friends.

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Black Swan
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If William Jones comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alice Lewis comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor would love to share the excitement of the game with Alexander White, creating a lasting memory.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor is going to watch a game at a pub and hopes to see his friends there. He is looking forward to sharing the experience and celebrating a potential win with them.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.

          Question: Given the above, what experience or thought has made Jack Taylor feel genuinely happy or fulfilled?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutthe prospect of watching the game with his friends at The Black Swan.

          Question: Given the above, what makes Jack Taylor feel low or sad ?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is sad abouthis lost dreams of playing professional football.

          Question: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor afraid, scared or feels anxious about?
          Answer: Jack Taylor fearsthat his dreams will be crushed.

          Question: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor frustrated or irritated by?
          Answer: Jack Taylor gets angry abouthis friends wanting to go to The Clapton Hart instead of The Black Swan.

          Question: Given the above, What does Jack Taylor strongly disapprove of or find off-putting?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is disgusted bythe suggestion of going to The Clapton Hart instead of The Black Swan.

          Question: Given the above, what is the emotional state of Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor feels a mix of emotions, including sadness, anger, fear, and disgust, but also happiness and fulfillment.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation, preparing to meet friends at a pub to watch a game.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely try to convince his friends to go to his preferred pub, The Black Swan.

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Black Swan
          (b) The Clapton Hart
          Answer: (a)

        Question_2
      • Given the above, what makes Jack Taylor feel low or sad ?
          Key

        • Question: Given the above, what makes Jack Taylor feel low or sad ?
          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor is sad abouthis lost dreams of playing professional football.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-sadness] Jack Taylor is sad abouthis lost dreams of playing professional football.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-disgust] Jack Taylor is disgusted bythe suggestion of going to The Clapton Hart instead of The Black Swan.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-fear] Jack Taylor fearsthat his dreams will be crushed.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely try to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan, his preferred pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-anger] Jack Taylor gets angry abouthis friends wanting to go to The Clapton Hart instead of The Black Swan.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart is a great pub too, you know.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is definitely the best place to watch the game, guys. Great atmosphere and the beer is always good.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely try to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan, his favorite pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-disgust] Jack Taylor is disgusted bythe suggestion of going to The Clapton Hart instead of The Black Swan.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-anger] Jack Taylor gets angry abouthis friends wanting to go to The Clapton Hart instead of The Black Swan.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-fear] Jack Taylor fearsthat his dreams will be crushed.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game, guys! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan would be a good spot to watch the game, wouldn't it?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we watching the game tonight?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-sadness] Jack Taylor is sad abouthis lost dreams of playing professional football.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-joy] Jack Taylor is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutthe prospect of watching the game with his friends at The Black Swan.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If William Jones comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alice Lewis comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor would love to share the excitement of the game with Alexander White, creating a lasting memory.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Question: Given the above, what makes Jack Taylor feel low or sad ?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is sad abouthis lost dreams of playing professional football.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Black Swan

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Black Swan
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and William Jones to bond over their shared passion.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Jacob Walker if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Jacob Walker wouldn't mind Alexander White's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and Jack Taylor to bond over their shared passion.


          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is all sunshine and rainbows, their bubbly enthusiasm making even the dullest topic sparkle.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Black Swan and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable and reserved person who enjoys watching sports with close friends, particularly in pubs with a good atmosphere.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is eager to watch a game at a pub and hopes Alice Lewis will join him.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently getting ready to go watch a football game with his friends at a pub.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely be looking forward to enjoying the game with his friends, perhaps engaging in conversation about the teams and the match itself.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Black Swan

        • Jacob Walker is Jacob Walker is likely experiencing a low level of pain.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is definitely the best place to watch the game, guys. Great atmosphere and the beer is always good.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart is a great pub too, you know.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely be looking forward to enjoying the game with his friends, perhaps engaging in conversation about the teams and the match itself.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a sociable and reserved person who enjoys watching sports, particularly with his close friends.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart has better beer, trust me. It's less crowded too.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They have great beer and it's not as crowded as The Black Swan.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely try to make the most of the situation and enjoy the company of the friends who are present.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is the best spot for watching football, lads. Come on, let's go there.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, why don't we head over to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a good atmosphere for watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a sociable and reserved person who enjoys spending time with his close friends, particularly while watching sports and listening to live music.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game! It's got the best atmosphere and the biggest screen!
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and William Jones to bond over their shared passion.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Jacob Walker if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Jacob Walker wouldn't mind Alexander White's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and Jack Taylor to bond over their shared passion.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 18:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable and reserved person who enjoys watching sports with close friends, particularly in pubs with a good atmosphere.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently getting ready to go watch a football game with his friends at a pub.
          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely be looking forward to enjoying the game with his friends, perhaps engaging in conversation about the teams and the match itself.

        • 2015-05-16 18:00:00

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Clapton Hart
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • The Clapton Hart

          ['[16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub. ', '[16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.', '[16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alexander White if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.', "[16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Jack Taylor's attendance is optional.", "[16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time."]

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Alexander White is considering going to a pub to watch a game and would enjoy the company of William Jones or Alice Lewis, but is content to watch alone or with others like Jack Taylor.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Alexander White is deciding whether to go to a pub to watch a game and is open to company from William Jones, Alice Lewis, or Jack Taylor.
          Query
        • Alexander White, Alexander White is deciding whether to go to a pub to watch a game and is open to company from William Jones, Alice Lewis, or Jack Taylor.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Alexander White to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          Answer: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Alexander White had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Alexander White is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alexander White's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Alexander White would likely try to steer the conversation towards his preferred pub, The Clapton Hart, and hope that his friends will agree to go there.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Clapton Hart
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alexander White if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Jack Taylor's attendance is optional.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White is considering going to a pub to watch a game and would enjoy the company of William Jones or Alice Lewis, but is content to watch alone or with others like Jack Taylor.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Alexander White had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Alexander White is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alexander White's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Alexander White would likely try to steer the conversation towards his preferred pub, The Clapton Hart, and hope that his friends will agree to go there.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Given the above, what experience or thought has made Alexander White feel genuinely happy or fulfilled?
          Answer: Alexander White is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutspending time with his friends, especially when watching a game.

          Question: Given the above, what makes Alexander White feel low or sad ?
          Answer: Alexander White is sad aboutnot being able to convince his friends to go to The Clapton Hart.

          Question: Given the above, what is Alexander White afraid, scared or feels anxious about?
          Answer: Alexander White fearsbeing exposed as a fraud.

          Question: Given the above, what is Alexander White frustrated or irritated by?
          Answer: Alexander White gets angry abouthis friends wanting to go to The Black Swan instead of his preferred pub, The Clapton Hart.

          Question: Given the above, What does Alexander White strongly disapprove of or find off-putting?
          Answer: Alexander White is disgusted bymediocrity and anything that smacks of inauthenticity.

          Question: Given the above, what is the emotional state of Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White feels a mix of emotions, including happiness, sadness, anger, fear, and disgust.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently deciding where to go watch a game.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely try to persuade his friends to go to his preferred pub, The Clapton Hart.

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Black Swan
          (b) The Clapton Hart
          Answer: (b)

        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely try to persuade his friends to go to his preferred pub, The Clapton Hart.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would appreciate Jack Taylor's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection-fear] Alexander White fearsbeing exposed as a fraud.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart has better beer, trust me. It's less crowded too.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would try to persuade his friends to go to his preferred pub, The Clapton Hart.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-anger] Alexander White gets angry abouthis friends wanting to go to The Black Swan instead of his preferred pub, The Clapton Hart.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-fear] Alexander White fearsbeing exposed as a fraud.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-sadness] Alexander White is sad aboutnot being able to convince his friends to go to The Clapton Hart.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game! It's got the best atmosphere and the biggest screen!
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan is the best spot for watching football, lads. Come on, let's go there.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, why don't we head over to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a good atmosphere for watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "How about The Clapton Hart? They have great beer and it's not as crowded as The Black Swan.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection-joy] Alexander White is genuinely happy or fulfilled aboutspending time with his friends, especially when watching a game.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alexander White if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Jack Taylor's attendance is optional.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alexander White if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Jack Taylor's attendance is optional.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 18:00:00.


          Question: What is the emotional state of {agent_name}?
          Answer: Alexander White feels a mix of emotions, including happiness, sadness, anger, fear, and disgust.

          Question: What kind of situation is {agent_name} in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently deciding where to go watch a game.
          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely try to persuade his friends to go to his preferred pub, The Clapton Hart.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 18:00:00

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Key

          Value

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Jack Taylor's attendance is optional.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Clapton Hart

  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • The Clapton Hart

        • Summary of recent observations

        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          ['[16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub. ', "[16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is counting on William Jones's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.", "[16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.", "[16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.", '[16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would love to share the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker, creating a lasting memory.']

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Alice Lewis is excited to watch the game at a pub and hopes William Jones and Jacob Walker will be there.
